Guoliang "Tony" Wang wrote:
> I just downloaded the Heritrix 3.0 and tried to launch it through SSH by 
> bin/heritrix -p 8081 -x -a PASSWORD, however, I got errors:
> 
>     Fri Jan 29 23:53:47 MST 2010 Starting heritrix
>     ERROR: JVM terminated without running Heritrix.
>     This could be due to invalid JAVA_OPTS or JMX_PORT, etc.
>     See heritrix_out.log for more details.
>     Here are its last three lines:
> 
>                                      password, and key password for
>     HTTPS use. Separate with commas, no
>                                      whitespace.
> 
> 
> I wonder what's wrong. and what's the keystore path?  I am trying to 
> read the online manual 
> https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Running+Heritrix+3.0

There will be more info in full heritrix_out.log.

There is no '-x' option in H3, so that may be the main problem.

You *may* provide a compatible keystore if you want to supply your own 
certificate for HTTPS purposes; however, if you don't, a self-signed 
certificate will be created the first time it's needed, then reused in 
the future (so that each browser that 'permanently' accepts that 
self-signed certificate only needs to do so once). I don't think that's 
related to the problem here.

- Gordon @ IA
